Comment: Trump claims that Tina Peters is a "political prisoner". Here's what Ayn Rand had to say about "political" crimes:   "There can be no such thing as a political crime under the American system of law. Since an individual has the right to hold and to propagate any ideas he chooses (obviously including political ideas), the government may not infringe his right; it may neither penalize nor reward him for his ideas; it may not take any judicial cognizance whatever of his ideology.  By the same principle, the government may not give special leniency to the perpetrator of a crime, on the grounds of the nature of his ideas."  [https://courses.aynrand.org/works/political-crimes](https://courses.aynrand.org/works/political-crimes)

Comment: I watched the whole trial, and it was such a clear-cut case of Tina being a bad actor both during the crimes, and also during the trial. That's why Tina said she was fucked as soon as the video from Ron Watkins (yes, Q) went online that showed his data came from her office and machines. She was caught sending her friend, Sherronna Bishop, to her office in the middle of the night to pick up the equipment. They also showed that another Colorado clerk made an image of the Dominion machines, which is what Tina claims is all she did. The other clerk was never charged because he didn't do all the other things Tina did, particularly the crime stuff like stealing equipment, and sharing the images and equipment with her band of weirdos. She also told Mike Lindell's lawyer that Mike and him had full use of her office, giving them full control to run their conspiracy.  Her lawyers were trying every shady trick they could, they tried to infer that the Colorado prosecutors had given Sherronna Bishop immunity to federal prosecution by letting her testify, which was not what they did and they can't even offer. To be fair her legal team was pretty new, she fired her old lawyers a few months before the trial, because her first legal team was trying to temper her insanity. So she hired Lindell's pick of lawyers, who just encouraged her bad-faith defense.
